title: Brexit vote: Will Boris Johnson's deal pass through Parliament? We crunch the numbers
text:
Boris Johnson’s hopes of getting his Brexit deal through parliament were dealt a blow by the DUP’s insistence that they can't support his proposals as they currently stand.

However, due to the more positive mood music emanating from other parliamentary factions, the Prime Minister might not necessarily need the 10 DUP MPs' support.

The introduction of the Benn Act means that Mr Johnson’s best hope of fulfilling his promise to leave the EU by the end of October rests on passing a deal.

After finalising an agreement at Thursday’s EU summit, he will attempt to get it through parliament today in what would be the fourth meaningful...
description: Boris Johnson’s hopes of getting his Brexit deal through parliament were dealt a blow by the DUP’s insistence that they can't support his proposals as they currently stand.
